@Buff_Monkey Hi Bob! Sounds like you experienced momentary outages. The system is designed to briefly cut power when sensing a fault, such as when a tree limb falls. If it clears, the condition no longer exists & the line stays energized. This is why you may lose power for a few seconds. 1/2

Jones: ZEN legislation is good for Ohio, not just FirstEnergy. ZEN can play key role in helping us meet future energy needs of all Ohioans.
Jones: Ohio cannot afford to continue heading down a path that could lead to less fuel-diversity, more imports and less economic growth.
Jones: ZEN is about the state of Ohio taking action to address environmental, fuel diversity and other key attributes of nuclear.
Jones: Ohio nuclear plants are economic engines -- 4,300+ jobs and $25M last year in state and local taxes to support key public services.
Jones: Nuclear plants can operate around the clock and are nearly twice as efficient as natural gas-fired plants.
Jones: Ohio‚Äôs nuclear plants generate enough electricity to power 2.8 million homes + produce 90% of Ohio's carbon-free electricity.
Jones: By helping value Ohio‚Äôs nuclear plants, ZEN will assure they continue to support jobs, economic growth, environmental progress.
Jones: The legislation plays a key role in efforts to provide Ohio customers with safe, resilient, clean and affordable electricity.
Jones: ZEN would enable Ohio to take control of a critical component of its energy future by valuing nuclear plant benefits.
Jones: Of the 14 states with the highest average electricity prices, 10 are importers of power.
Jones: Fewer homegrown energy resources means more electricity imports from neighboring states.
Jones: Our longstanding commitment is to maintain adequate supplies of clean, diverse electricity here in our state.
Jones: Nuclear units are prematurely closing, undermining efforts to create jobs, protect the environment, maintain energy security.
Jones: It is important to balance electricity affordability with environmental benefits, fuel diversity, other attributes.
Jones: Today‚Äôs federal construct does not value key attributes that nuclear power plants provide. They are important to Ohio.
Jones: Ohio is facing serious and very complex energy policy problems that need immediate attention from Ohio General Assembly.
Jones: I express strong support for House Bill 178 sponsored by Rep. Anthony Devitis.
